subject: Leadership
title: Analysis Paralysis
description: A quick win: understand Analysis Paralysis.

hook.text: The team gathers more data, runs another meeting, requests one more report. Weeks pass. Nothing happens.

buildup.text: Analysis paralysis occurs when overthinking prevents action. The pursuit of perfect information kills momentum.

discovery.text: Herbert Simon coined 'satisficing': choosing a good-enough option rather than searching endlessly for the best one.

twist.text: In fast-moving environments, a decent decision today beats a perfect decision next month. The window closes.

climax.text: Leaders break paralysis by setting deadlines, limiting options, and accepting that some uncertainty is permanent.

punchline.text: Done is better than perfect. Decide, learn, adjust.
